citation.article-title: Characterization of the anaerobic propionate-degrading syntrophs Smithella propionica gen. nov., sp. nov. and Syntrophobacter wolinii.

p.s: Description of Smithella propionica sp. nov.
Smithella propionica (pro.pi.o'ni.ca. M.L. n. acidum propionicum propionic acid ; M.L. adj. propionica pertaining to propionic acid, on which the bacterium grows)
Gram-negative rods, 0.5 μm in diameter, with most cells 3-5 μm long, but some cells as long as 10 μm.
Fastest growth with pH near neutral and Na+ and Cl- concentrations less than 100mM.
Grows syntrophically on propionate with H2- or formate-using methanogenic partner.
Grows slowly axenically by dismutating crotonate to butyrate and acetate.
